results.title: Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: We found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced CA1 reactive @DISEASE_Gliosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrocytosis@@@, demonstrated by a significant 37% decrease in @GENE_GFAP @GENE_14580 @@@GFAP@@@-positive cells, and that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ prevented the @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal loss@@@ in CA1, demonstrated by a significant 42% increase in the @GENE_RBFOX3 @GENE_52897 @@@NeuN@@@-positive cells, as compared to the findings in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Kainic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007608 @@@kainic acid@@@-induced @DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@ treated by a saline solution.

citations.NLM: Hanin A, Roussel D, Lecas S, Baudin P, Navarro V. Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin. Epilepsy Behav. 2023 Apr;141():109133. PMID: 36813661
citations.BibTeX: @article{36813661, title={Repurposing of cholesterol-lowering agents in status epilepticus: A neuroprotective effect of simvastatin.}, author={Hanin A and Roussel D and Lecas S and Baudin P and Navarro V}, journal={Epilepsy Behav}, volume={141}, pages={109133}}

results.title: Combined Treatment with Hydrophilic and Lipophilic Statins Improves Neurological Outcomes Following Experimental Cardiac Arrest in Mice.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Combination treatment with @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal injury@@@ in the striatum and hippocampus, reduced @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@cerebral edema@@@, and improved general health at 4 days after @DISEASE_Heart_Arrest @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@CA@@@/CPR.

citations.NLM: Nakayama S, Taguchi N, Isaka Y, Nakamura T, Tanaka M. Combined Treatment with Hydrophilic and Lipophilic Statins Improves Neurological Outcomes Following Experimental Cardiac Arrest in Mice. Neurocrit Care. 2020 Aug;33(1):64-72. PMID: 31591692
citations.BibTeX: @article{31591692, title={Combined Treatment with Hydrophilic and Lipophilic Statins Improves Neurological Outcomes Following Experimental Cardiac Arrest in Mice.}, author={Nakayama S and Taguchi N and Isaka Y and Nakamura T and Tanaka M}, journal={Neurocrit Care}, volume={33}, number={1}, pages={64-72}}

results.title: Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ alleviated @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuron death@@@ induced by A1 astrocytes.

citations.NLM: Du RW, Bu WG. Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes. Neuroimmunomodulation. 2021;28(2):82-89. PMID: 33735898
citations.BibTeX: @article{33735898, title={Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes.}, author={Du RW and Bu WG}, journal={Neuroimmunomodulation}, volume={28}, number={2}, pages={82-89}}

results.title: Simvastatin prevents the inflammatory process and the dopaminergic degeneration induced by the intranigral injection of lipopolysaccharide.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ prevents the @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ process and the @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@dopaminergic degeneration@@@ induced by the intranigral injection of @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@lipopolysaccharide@@@.

citations.NLM: Hernández-Romero MC, Argüelles S, Villarán RF, de Pablos RM, Delgado-Cortés MJ, Santiago M, Herrera AJ, Cano J, Machado A. Simvastatin prevents the inflammatory process and the dopaminergic degeneration induced by the intranigral injection of lipopolysaccharide. J Neurochem. 2008 Apr;105(2):445-59. PMID: 18047562

results.title: Simvastatin prevents oxygen and glucose deprivation/reoxygenation-induced death of cortical neurons by reducing the production and toxicity of 4-hydroxy-2E-nonenal.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ markedly decreased the OGD/reoxygenation-evoked @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@death of cortical neurons@@@.

citations.NLM: Lim JH, Lee JC, Lee YH, Choi IY, Oh YK, Kim HS, Park JS, Kim WK. Simvastatin prevents oxygen and glucose deprivation/reoxygenation-induced death of cortical neurons by reducing the production and toxicity of 4-hydroxy-2E-nonenal. J Neurochem. 2006 Apr;97(1):140-50. PMID: 16515553
citations.BibTeX: @article{16515553, title={Simvastatin prevents oxygen and glucose deprivation/reoxygenation-induced death of cortical neurons by reducing the production and toxicity of 4-hydroxy-2E-nonenal.}, author={Lim JH and Lee JC and Lee YH and Choi IY and Oh YK and Kim HS and Park JS and Kim WK}, journal={J Neurochem}, volume={97}, number={1}, pages={140-50}}

results.title: Simvastatin reduces the association of NMDA receptors to lipid rafts: a cholesterol-mediated effect in neuroprotection.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Treatment with the inhibitors of @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ synthesis @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, which inhibits the first step of @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ synthesis, or @CHEMICAL_trans_1_4_Bis(2_chlorobenzaminomethyl)cyclohexane_Dihydrochloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001371 @@@AY9944@@@, which inhibits the last step of @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ synthesis, protected neurons from NMDA-induced @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal death@@@ by 70% and 54%, respectively.

citations.NLM: Ponce J, de la Ossa NP, Hurtado O, Millan M, Arenillas JF, Dávalos A, Gasull T. Simvastatin reduces the association of NMDA receptors to lipid rafts: a cholesterol-mediated effect in neuroprotection. Stroke. 2008 Apr;39(4):1269-75. PMID: 18323503
citations.BibTeX: @article{18323503, title={Simvastatin reduces the association of NMDA receptors to lipid rafts: a cholesterol-mediated effect in neuroprotection.}, author={Ponce J and de la Ossa NP and Hurtado O and Millan M and Arenillas JF and Dávalos A and Gasull T}, journal={Stroke}, volume={39}, number={4}, pages={1269-75}}

results.title: Simvastatin pretreatment protects cerebrum from neuronal injury by decreasing the expressions of phosphor-CaMK II and AQP4 in ischemic stroke rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ pretreatment protects cerebrum from @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal injury@@@ by decreasing the expressions of phosphor-CaMK II and @GENE_AQP4 @GENE_25293 @@@AQP4@@@ in @DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@ischemic stroke@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhu MX, Lu C, Xia CM, Qiao ZW, Zhu DN. Simvastatin pretreatment protects cerebrum from neuronal injury by decreasing the expressions of phosphor-CaMK II and AQP4 in ischemic stroke rats. J Mol Neurosci. 2014 Dec;54(4):591-601. PMID: 24752488

results.title: Simvastatin and atorvastatin improve behavioral outcome, reduce hippocampal degeneration, and improve cerebral blood flow after experimental traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ improve behavioral outcome, reduce @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@hippocampal degeneration@@@, and improve cerebral blood flow after experimental @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@traumatic brain injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Wang H, Lynch JR, Song P, Yang HJ, Yates RB, Mace B, Warner DS, Guyton JR, Laskowitz DT. Simvastatin and atorvastatin improve behavioral outcome, reduce hippocampal degeneration, and improve cerebral blood flow after experimental traumatic brain injury. Exp Neurol. 2007 Jul;206(1):59-69. results.title: Synergistic benefits of erythropoietin and simvastatin after traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: Prominent effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ include its anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@, neurotrophic and neuroregenerative actions studied in various models of @<m>DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Chauhan NB, Gatto R. Synergistic benefits of erythropoietin and simvastatin after traumatic brain injury. Brain Res. 2010 Nov 11;1360():177-92. PMID: 20833152
